description:
Denji is a teenage boy living with a Chainsaw Devil named Pochita. Due to the debt his father left behind, he has been living a rock-bottom life while repaying his debt by harvesting devil corpses with Pochita.

One day, Denji is betrayed and killed. As his consciousness fades, he makes a contract with Pochita and gets revived as "Chainsaw Man" — a man with a devil's heart.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Monster Boy
tags.description: Prominently features a male character who is a part-monster.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Psychosexual
tags.description: Work that involves the psychological aspects of sexual impulses.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Cannibalism
tags.description: Prominently features the act of consuming another member of the same species as food.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: POV
tags.description: Point of View; features scenes shown from the perspective of the series protagonist.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Homeless
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is homeless.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Zombie
tags.description: Prominently features reanimated corpses which often prey on live humans and turn them into zombies.

tags.name: Angels
tags.description: Prominently features spiritual beings usually represented with wings and halos and believed to be attendants of God.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

node.description: [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nagayama_koharu)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1382466685257457664)

Founder of Creative unit [Andraft](https://anilist.co/studio/7483/Andraft).
Hiroshi Seko is a screenwriter.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/325492584) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=tatsuya_yoshihara)

Freelance animator formerly affiliated with [Actas](https://anilist.co/studio/60/) where he was attending its internal animation school and debuted as animator at the age of 20. His work has been greatly influenced by contemporary Kanada school animators [Seiya Numata](https://anilist.co/staff/124320/) and [Hironori Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/103979/). 

He's a precocious talent, debuting as episode director at the age of 21 and as director at the age of 23 with [Arve Rezzle](https://anilist.co/anime/13863/), as part of the Young Animator Training Project.

Married to fellow animator [Kikuko Sadakata](https://anilist.co/staff/105769).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tt_totos) | [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/totototos.bsky.social)

__[Website](https://www.agraph.jp/)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/4L0gz16xuM1as1OgYzh1SR)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/agraph)__

Kensuke Ushio, alternatively known by stage name agraph, is a Japanese musician, DJ, composer, arranger, programmer, remixer and member of rock band [Lama](http://www.sonymusic.co.jp/artist/lama/profile/).

When he was a child Kensuke learned to play the piano, while later at University he started studying arts and music, in addition to also learning how to use audio editing software like Pro Tools. At the age of 20, Kensuke first came in contact with the electronic music world known as techno. 

In 2007, he would start his solo career under the stage name agraph, this is when he started to create his own electronic music. His debut album titled A Day, Phases, produced by Takkyu Ishino, was released in December of 2008. Skipping to 2010, he would release his second album titled Equal which managed to rank in the Japanese Albums Charts.

In 2011, Kensuke and former musicians from the bands Supercar and Number Girl formed a rock band called Lama. The band has released two albums, which both managed to rank in the official Albums Charts of Japan.  It was later revealed that due to his involvement in the rock band Lama, he wouldn't be able to release a third album until 6 years after his second album. His third album titled The Shader was released in 2016.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://x.com/naomi_nakano_8?t=du26TQSGyB-QUe8z-Iaqsg&s=09) | [Stella](https://stella-quartz.jp/)

Founder and president of Stella.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/42141740)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/t_bamboo)

He grew up in Mexico because of his parents' work. In elementary school he read Ishinomori Shoutarou's Cyborg 009. Later he experienced the Yamato and Gundam boom, prompting him to be interested in animation. He started working as background artist, later becoming freelance. During that time Takeda got acquainted with Tokuhiro Hiragi and Tatsuya Kushida, whom he then helped establishing the art studio Bihou in 1993.

In 2005 he established the independent art studio Bamboo, which became a company in 2007.

(Source: AniDB)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/miyafic)

The representative director of Capsule, a CG animation company

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/binobinobi) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/押山清高)

Co-founder and Representative Director of [Studio Durian](https://anilist.co/studio/6283/).
Animation Producer and Executive Officer at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/MAPPA).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1382466685257457664)

Founder of Creative unit [Andraft](https://anilist.co/studio/7483/Andraft).
Freelance Animator. Often seen working at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/325492584) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=tatsuya_yoshihara)

Freelance animator formerly affiliated with [Actas](https://anilist.co/studio/60/) where he was attending its internal animation school and debuted as animator at the age of 20. His work has been greatly influenced by contemporary Kanada school animators [Seiya Numata](https://anilist.co/staff/124320/) and [Hironori Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/103979/). 

He's a precocious talent, debuting as episode director at the age of 21 and as director at the age of 23 with [Arve Rezzle](https://anilist.co/anime/13863/), as part of the Young Animator Training Project.

Married to fellow animator [Kikuko Sadakata](https://anilist.co/staff/105769).
Started working as an animator for Studio LAN. Currently a freelance animator.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1382466685257457664)

Founder of Creative unit [Andraft](https://anilist.co/studio/7483/Andraft).
Animator and episode director affiliated with [E&H Productions](https://anilist.co/studio/7229/EH-Productions)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1382466685257457664)

Founder of Creative unit [Andraft](https://anilist.co/studio/7483/Andraft).

Originating from Eagle Nest. Currently freelance.

Tanaka first drew attention for the wild and imaginative fight sequences in Precure [Max Heart](https://anilist.co/anime/1929/) and [Splash Star](https://anilist.co/anime/1534/). Following this he expanded his scope and took up work on productions all around the industry, showing that fights aren't everything he can do. His variety on running sequences, often showing an effiminate touch, as well as the particular attention to hair, down to all little strains and often involving a hairdo having a life of its own, are some of Tanaka's most outstanding feats.

__Non-anime credits:__
~!
- Chief Animator, Animation Character Design, Storyboard, Director, Animation Director, Key Animation for "BlazBlue: Calamity Trigger (OP)" (video game, 2008)
- Key Animation for "Disgaea D2: A Brighter Darkness (OP)" (video game, 2013)
- Key Animation for "livetune adding Fukase (from SEKAI NO OWARI) 「Take Your Way」" (music video, 2013)
- Key Animation for "Rurouni Kenshin: Meiji Kenkaku Romantan Saisen (OP)" (video game, 2011)
- Key Animation for "Valkyria Chronicles III" (video game, 2011)!~
[Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=keiichiro_watanabe)
